snippet: Et tu, Michigan? Its unions aren’t powerless, but their influence is waning.
abstract: Op-Ed article by history and sociology professor Thomas J Sugrue observes that legislation signed by MIchigan Gov Rick Snyder preventing unions from forcing workers to pay dues is latest in series of setbacks for organized labor in the state; contends that declining influence of unions in Michigan has been going on for long time.
lead_paragraph: Et tu, Michigan? Its unions aren’t powerless, but their influence is waning.
